The active constituents having antioxidant activity in both herbal plants may possess a beneficial effect on skin surface, thus recommending these plants as the future of new antiaging products."

Description:
At times, our overall well-being and health can get interrupted when we get distracted by our immediate afflictions. Sage is an essential oil that revitalizes the body as a whole while also helping to restore our individual bodily systems.

With an herbaceous and sweet aroma, Sage has been acknowledged through history for its medicinal properties. Its name means “to save” in Latin because of its efficacy in helping a range of health issues.

Native to the Mediterranean, Sage is a small evergreen tree that is now cultivated worldwide. To extract the essential oil, the leaves are put through a steam distillation process.

(Edens Garden)
Hazards / Safety data: Not to be used during pregnancy and lactation.

Trade name: Salicylic Acid - Salix Nigra (Willow) Bark Extract
Description:
Antibacterial and keratolytic cosmetic active.

This Black Willow Bark extract concentrated in salicylic acid is a powerful ally to incorporate into your preparations for oily, dull or acne-prone skin. Purifying and keratolytic, it stimulates skin renewal, smoothes imperfections and fights blackheads, ingrown hairs and dandruff. It also improves the preservation of aqueous products and can be used to boost the effectiveness of preservatives. A much sought after active ingredient that we offer you in vegetable origin, better tolerated than synthetic salicylic acid.

Salicylic acid is a beta-hydroxy acid well known in cosmetics for its powerful keratolytic action and its antibacterial effects, making it an asset of choice for the care of skins with imperfections , but also dull or irregular skin (spots, wrinkles ...) because of its intense regenerating effect . The Salix nigra or Black Willow is a tree 13 meters high that grows in North America. Its dark brown and streaked bark contains tannins, molecules of the polyphenol family , whose antioxidant power is well-known. It is also particularly rich in salicyline , a natural derivative of salicylic acid. Salicyline gradually releases salicylic acid on the skin and allows you to take advantage of its powerful properties without having its irritating effects . 

Salicyline, known for its astringent and purifying properties , helps regulate oily skin and fight against imperfections. It is a soothing and regenerating allowing to repair the skin and reduce fine lines and wrinkles. 

Incorporated into cosmetic treatments, black willow extract helps to smooth and beautify the skin by reducing imperfections and preventing the formation of black spots . Incorporated into cleansing preparations, it cleanses the skin deeply , making it more beautiful and healthier. 

It is also an asset of choice for anti-dandruff shampoos , or for ingrown anti-hairs .
Composition:
Cosmetic, 100% natural extract, no preservatives added (salicylic acid naturally retains the product).
Highly concentrated extract, titrated to 10% salicylic acid equivalent.
Uses: acne-prone skin,anti-aging,blackheads,damaged skin,dull skin,hair - dandruff,hyperpigmentation,ingrown hair,oily hair,oily skin,scaly scalp,whiteheads
Formulation tips:
Add the active vegetable salicylic acid cold, at the end of formulation. Shake well to homogenize.

Natural salicylic acid is effective on bacteria, but less effective on yeasts and molds. For this reason, it is advisable to pair it with another preservative, such as Leucidal, Grapefruit Seed Extract, or the Benzoate & Sorbate Complex, which is often useful for "boosting".
Hazards / Safety data:
Do not use if allergic to aspirin and salicylates.
Salicylic acid is a potent active ingredient, always stick to recommended dosages. On sensitive skin, start with a fairly low dosage. Stop use if irritation occurs.
Stock: ☠️ Salicylic Acid - Salix Nigra (Willow) Bark Extract / 40

Description:
This deep amber or red oil will regenerate skin cells as well as combat wrinkles, dryness and burns. It's high in anti-oxidants and beta carotene and is beneficial for inflammatory skin conditions such as eczema.
(argan-republic.com)
---------------------
Sea buckthorn is a small shrub that is found very frequently in hedgerows . It is easily recognized by its orange berries that grow in very compact masses on the shrub. 
Used for millennia for its many virtues for health , sea buckthorn owes its name to its benefits. Indeed, Hippophae comes from the Greek Hippo : "horse" and phaos "shine" because at the time, it was observed that the horses that consumed it gained weight and had a shiny coat . Sea buckthorn oil has the particularity of bringing togethermany valuable active ingredients in large quantities, such as carotenoids (Provitamin A), Vitamin E , and essential fatty acids (omega-3 and omega-6).

 This unique combination gives the sea buckthorn oil powerful antioxidant properties , as well as a softening and repairing  power of exception for the skin. It is traditionally recommended for skincare and stretch marks to help regenerate the skin . In herbal medicine, sea buckthorn seed oil is often recommended as a supplement to the care of  atopic skin , and studies show that in internal use, it could improve the lipid composition of these skins. 

Another scientific study suggests that the consumption of this oil could help limit cholesterol deposits in the arteries, in addition to a suitable diet.
(Aroma-Zone)
Properties/actions: anti-aging,calming; soothing,emollient,fights agains free radical damage,lengthens the duration of tan,prepares the skin for tanning,regenerating,skin radiance,softening

Description:
Shea tree, sacred tree in many parts of Africa , produces edible nuts , used as food , but especially known for the virtues on the skin of the butter that is extracted from it. The Shea Nilotica is a subspecies of the tree Shea Vitellaria paradoxa (or Butyrospermum parkii), predominant in East Africa, throughout the Nile Valley. It is found in particular in Uganda and Sudan. 
The butter we offer comes mainly from the forest region around Lira , Uganda . The nuts Shea Nilotica, harvested from wild trees, are a good commercial resource for this recently war-ravaged region. The seeds are sent to Kenya, where they are pressed at low temperatures to retain all the properties of the butter .

The valuation of nuts of Shea Nilotica is ecologically very important because it helps to preserve these trees , which can live for many years, but are threatened by deforestation because they are prized for producing coal .

Richer in olein and less rich in stearin than Shea butter from West Africa, Nilotica has a much softer texture and penetrates the skin more easily . Its richness in unsaponifiables, including vitamin E, polyphenols and phytosterols makes it an exceptional cosmetic ingredient to make your preparations for sensitive skin, attacked (sun, wind, cold ..) and to prevent skin aging.
Composition:
Unsaponifiable of which: 


Tocopherols (vitamin E) : natural antioxidant

Polyphenols (gallic acid, catechin, epicatechin, gallocatechin, quercetin ...): antioxidants
Vitamin A: regenerating and antioxidant
Terpenic alcohols (in the form of cinnamic acid esters or fatty acid esters: alpha and beta amyrin, parkéol, lupeol, butyrospermol): anti-inflammatories, antioxidants, help maintain the elasticity of the skin and absorb UV rays.
Phytosterols (karistérols including alpha-spinasterol, delta-7-stigmasterol): improve the barrier function of the skin and microcirculation, slow skin aging, anti-inflammatory, protect against the action of UV.
Latex, including karitene (isoprene hydrocarbon): absorbs UV rays
Characteristics: Creamy,Fast absorption,Slightly rainy,Very stable regarding oxidation
Properties/actions: anti-oxidant,emollient,hair nourishing,hair protection,hair softener and smoother,"increases hair elasticity, manageability and shine",prevents dehydration,protecting,regenerating,skin nourishing,soothing

Description:
Simulgreen™ 18-2 is natural source, all-in-one liquid crystal emulsifier derived from castor oil and sugar that contains no ethoxylated ingredients. It is a non-ionic oil-in-water emulsifier that can be used to emulsify vegetable oils, silicones, and esters. It can emulsify oils when used as low as 2%, and has good compatibility with electrolytes.

Lotions made with Simulgreen™ 18-2 will be lighter and easier to spread than those made with traditional emulsifying waxes (creates much thinner lotions than with Polawax or Incroquat BTMS-50). It prevents the soaping effect found with other emulsifiers, and it is absorbed more quickly by the skin. Actives and lipids can penetrate the skin more easily due to the liquid crystal emulsion’s ability to mimic the lipid bilayers in our stratum corneum, leading to a reduction in transepidermal water loss and increase in moisturization.

It is ECOcert and Natrue approved, and derived from sustainable vegetable sources without the use of solvents. It is considered biodegradable.

Key benefits:

Natural source vegetable emulsifier from sustainable sources
No soaping effect in creams and lotions
ECOcert and Nature approved
Green technology ingredient
Characteristics: Fast absorption,Good spreading,No soaping effect,Produces light lotions
Functions: easy lotion spreadability,makes light lotions,penetration enhancer,prevents the soaping effect
Properties/actions: increase in moisturization,reduction in transepidermal water loss,skin penetration enhancer
Formulation tips:
Can handle electrolytes (aloe vera, sodium lactate...).

Xanthan gum at 0.5% can be used to increase stability. 
Fatty alcohols like cetyl alcohol, cetearyl alcohol, or behenyl alcohol used at low levels (1 to 3%) can also be used to help increase the formation of the liquid crystal structure. Simulgreen™ 18-2 offers a creamy texture as low as 3%, and can be used as low as 2% with vegetable oils. When making a lotion, it is suggested that the water phase be poured into the oil phase, then mixed using a stick blender before moving to a hand mixer.

EXAMPLE FORMULA (Lotion Crafter)
Formula
                     Percent  Grams  Ounces    Ingredient
Phase A           54.5      270.5  9.02     Distilled Water
                        10.0        50.0     1.67    Aloe Vera Juice 1X
                         4.0         20.0    0.67     Glycerin
                         2.0         10.0     0.33    Sodium Lactate
                         2.0         10.0     0.33    Hydrolyzed Rice Protein
                         0.5          2.5      0.08    Allantoin

Phase B           4.0          20.0    0.67    Simulgreen 18-2
                        10.0         50.0    1.67     Lotioncrafter FCO
                        10.0         50.0    1.67     Macadamia nut oil
                         0.5          2.5      0.08     Xanthan Gum Soft

Phase C           0.5          2.5      0.08     Liquid Germall Plus
                         2.0         10.0     0.33     DL Panthenol

1. Heat Phase A ingredients to 80°C (176°F). Cover and hold at this temperature for 20 minutes.
2. Heat Phase B ingredients to 80°C (176°F).
3. Add Phase A to Phase B and stick blend for about 2 minute, then switch to a hand mixer until the product reaches
45°C (113°F).
4. Add Phase C to the product and mix for about two minutes.
5. Pour into bottles when cool.
Makes 500 grams (16.6 oz)

Description:
1.5 times more effective in its water holding capacity than glycerine.

Sodium lactate is the sodium salt of lactic acid, is a natural humectant and moisturiser and is a part of our own NMF (natural moisturising factor). It is applied in cosmetic formulations for its moisturising functions and to adjust the pH (specially when buffering is needed). In certain cosmetic products, the pH of the product might change with time and this would lead to destabilization of some certain ingredients. This happens very often by applying urea or weak acid based emulsifiers and ingredients (citrate derivatives for example: glyceryl oleate citrate). In such cases you need to stabilize the pH with a buffering system (blending sodium lactate and lactic acid)
Buffered solutions resist changes in pH upon addition of small amount of acids or bases. Our blood for instance is a buffered system and its pH would not easily change.
Properties/actions: improves barrier properties of the skin,increases skin plasticity,reduces wrinkles,reduction in transepidermal water loss,stimulates ceramide synthesis in the skin
Uses: acne-prone skin,dehydrated skin,mature skin
Formulation tips: It loses its efficacy when we wash the area it was applied on.

Description:
A sulfate free alternative for Sodium Lauryl SulfoAcetate

EasyFoam (Sodium Lauroyl Sarcosinate) is a natural, food grade, anionic surfactant derived from the sodium salt of fatty acids and sarcosine amino acids.  EasyFoam is one of the oldest running cleansing agents and has been used in dental hygiene since the original production of toothpaste.  Unlike many others on the market, the Ingredients To Die For EasyFoam (Sodium Lauroyl Sarcosinate) is pure and  a min. 95% active.

Like the Lactylates, EasyFoam is of acyl structure making it ideal for natural cleansing systems where it offers an abundance of soft light foam. 

Offering unsurpassed hair support, and smooth feel on application, this is the surfactant of choice for all of your natural hair cleansers. 

The high water solubility makes this the perfect choice for foaming bath powders, bath bombs, and bath powders or soaks.  When you develop bath bombs with the classic baking soda and citric acid you can take them to the next level by giving them a nice foaming quality with the addition of EasyFoam.  As the bath bomb begins to fizz it will create enough friction to produce the foam taking your fizz bath to a foam bath, and the ultimate bath soak.  This may also be added to bath salts and have them added to running water for foam.  Don't forget, you can also add emollience to your bath bombs and bath powder soaks by adding a small amount of your favorite carrier oil so that you can offer your customer the ultimate foaming, emollient, bath bomb or bath powder soak. 

See our Formulary for basic information on making your own bath soak information and bath bomb starter recipes.

ATTRIBUTES 
Hair
Increased Body
Increased Suppleness
Improved Sheen
Improved Texture
Damage Repair (physical or chemical processing damage)
Skin
Effective but Gentle Cleansing
Won't Strip Moisture
Leaves Skin Feeling Soft
APPLICATIONS
Bath Bombs
Bath Powders
Powder Bath Soaks
Shaving Creams
Bath & Body Wash
Face Wash
Laundry Products
Shampoos
Type of formulation: Shampoo,Foaming bath powders,Bath bombs,Bath powders,Makeup remover
Recommended dosage: 3-10% for shampoos and bath products; 1-2% for lotions and make-up removers.

Description:
Sodium PCA is a natural moisturizer and humectant and is the sodium salt of PCA which is present at 12% in our own NMF (natural moisturizing factor). PCA is derived from L-Glutamic acid. Na-PCA has a much superior moisturizing efficacy than glycerine .

It is a colourless and odourless aqueous solution and very easy to apply. You can add it to the warm or cold water phase in all hair and skin care products. 
In haircare, it reduces flyaway and static electricity and improves wet combability as well as colour retention after hair dying.
Composition: Na-PCA 50% aqueous solution
Formulation tips: You can add it to the warm or cold water phase in all hair and skin care products.

Description:
Spearmint is the essential oil that can help you steal little moments of calm back as it gently uplifts with a minty and bright aroma.
Often confused with Peppermint, Spearmint is cooling and more nuanced. 
For thousands of the years, Spearmint’s medicinal and therapeutic properties have been explored. The Ancient Greeks used it to restore the body while adding a lovely fragrance to their bathwater. The flowering herbs are put through a steam distillation process to extract the oil, which can add a minty note to floral essential oil blend. (edens garden)

- Inhaled, it is truly a memoristic anti-depressant. It relieves mental strain and fatigue, cheers you up and tonifies your entire system.
Therapeutically, (...) for remembrance of childhood and a feeling of freeedom and lightness, Spearmint oil is the best. (Jeanne Rose, The Aromatherapy Book)

- A mildly stimulating, memoristic antidepressant; Spearmint is bound to make you happy, relaxed and joyful, hence, “Oil of Joy”. 
(http://www.jeannerose.net/articles/25_essentials.html)
-------------------------------------------------------------
In terms of fragrance energetics, Spearmint is sweet, green, pungent and cool. As applied to the psyche, these qualities signal the potential for promoting emotional stability and renewal. By addressing the sensory-emotional dysregulation caused by deep limbic system hyperfunctioning, Spearmint can be helpful for those unable to let go of distressed feelings and negative emotions. Just as it can treat stagnation in the lungs and the upper digestion, so it can give one the energy to take a fresh look at stuck feelings, emotional conflicts and the like. In so doing, Spearmint by olfaction can help resolve emotional stagnation, reduce emotional confusion or ambivalence, and help the individual move forward in a more positive and conscious direction.
(Peter Holmes, Aromatica, vol. 1)
Uses: acne-prone skin,burns,dermatitis,dull skin,oily skin,reactive skin,scars,wounds; scratches

Description:
Spectrastat G2-N is a broadspectrum preservative for natural personal care (hair and skin care) and is the only (till now) natural preservative with a performance that is not pH-dependant.

This is lipophilic (oil soluble) preservative. Spectrastat G2-N has no impact on the colour and scent of the final product. If you're making products with a pH lower than 5 or higher than 5,5 (baby care, pet care, suncare, hair conditioner, hair rinse, etc.) this is the ideal preservative for your product.

It is not compatible with iron containing ingredients such as most clays. 
Dosage: 0,8-1,2%. Add this preservative during the cool down phase

This is one of the rare preservatives compatible with Emulsense HC
Stable within a pH range of: is the only (till now) natural preservative with a performance that is not pH-dependant
Formulation tips:
Add this preservative during the cool down phase. 
It is not compatible with iron containing ingredients such as most clays.
Hazards / Safety data: It is not compatible with iron containing ingredients such as most clays.
Not to be used during pregnancy and lactation.

Appearance: Poudre fine (lyophilisée et micronisée) verte foncée.
Description:
Actif cosmétique nutritif, anti-âge et fortifiant capillaire

La Spiruline est une algue bleue microscopique naturellement riche en acides aminés, en protéines et en vitamines. Ces nombreux nutriments la rendent intéressante dans les soins de la peau pour freiner l'apparition des rides. Sa teneur en vitamines A et E lui permet d'être utilisée dans les préparations pour peaux matures et pour lutter contre les signes du vieillissement cutané.
C'est un ingrédient très apprécié dans les spas et les instituts pour réaliser des masques et des enveloppements marins

La Spiruline est une algue bleue de la famille de Cyanophycées. Elle se présente sous la forme d'un filament spiralé et se développe naturellement dans les eaux tropicales ou subtropicales.

BEAUTÉ
PROPRIÉTÉS
Sa richesse en nutriments et notamment en protéines lui offre des propriétés revitalisantes, fortifiantes et nutritives exceptionnelles.
Améliore la souplesse et l'élasticité de la peau.
Participe à la prévention de l'apparition des rides.
Apporte une teinte vert bleuté très sympa à vos cosmétiques (utiliser à faible dose dans les produits non rincés car elle va colorer).
UTILISATIONS
S'utilise en tant qu'ingrédient dans vos préparations :

Soins anti-âge à connotation marine : crèmes, gels.
Préparation de produits de soins spa et thalasso : masques visage, enveloppements corporels
Soins réparateurs et fortifiants pour la kératine des cheveux, des ongles et des cils
QUELQUES IDÉES
Cataplasme et enveloppement marins
Soin revitalisant pour le corps
Masque reminéralisant du visage
Composition:
La culture de la Spiruline que nous vous proposons suit des procédés 100 % naturels (soleil, culture en bassins fermés ventilés sous le contrôle de microbiologistes expérimentés, dans une eau de qualité contrôlée). Après filtration de l'eau, la Spiruline est lavée, séchée et micronisée.

- Protéines : plus de 70 % de sa matière sèche
- Vitamines A et E : au fort pouvoir antioxydant
Uses: mature skin,thin hair
acne-prone skin,dry skin,dull skin
Safety - Therapeutic status: Mild with no chronic cumulative toxicity

Description:
Squalene is found naturally in the sebum of human skin and is believed to lubricate and protect skin. Squalane, its hydrogenated cousin, is widely used as a conditioner, emollient and carrier oil in cosmetic formulations. It is easy to emulsify, chemically inert, but soluble in most cosmetic oils including cyclomethicone. It is an elegant emollient with exceptional spreading properties and skin absorption that can be used in emulsions, balms, facial serums and massage oils, or as a carrier for essential oils.
(Lotion Crafter)

Squalane is a stable derivative of squalene , a natural component of human sebum . Squalene is also the predominant compound in the famous "unsaponifiable" fraction, which contributes significantly to the cosmetic virtues of olive oil .

Due to its biomimetic structure (similar to lipids constituting the natural lipid film of the skin), squalane has an excellent affinity with the skin and plays the role of a natural emollient .

It has a silky touch very thin, non-greasy and penetrates the skin very easily. Squalane strengthens the cutaneous lipid barrier , softens and softens the skin and protects it from dehydration. (Aroma-zone)
-------
Squalane is a saturated form of squalene in which the double bonds have been eliminated by hydrogenation. Squalane is less susceptible to oxidation than squalene. 
(...) An added boon of squalane is that even though it is technically oil, it does not have an oily feel, is odorless, noncomedonal, antibacterial, and is safe for sensitive skin.[11] Besides its emollient action, it is also used in treating skin disorders such as seborrheic dermatitis, acne, psoriasis, or atopic dermatitis. (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4885180/)
-------
The Cosmetic Ingredient Review Expert Panel noted that studies indicated that squalene was slowly absorbed through the skin. (The importance and perspective of plant-based squalene in cosmetology. K Wołosik, M Knaś, A Zalewska, M Niczyporuk, AW Przystupa. Journal of cosmetic science 64 - https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/b0ee/797e3c67867d6e7544af443eebdf49474d7c.pdf)
Characteristics: Good absorption,Good spreading,Non-greasy,Silky feel,Stable to oxidation
Properties/actions: anti-oxidant,emollient,hair protection,hair repair,helps maintain hair hydration,hydrating,improves hair strength,improves skin elasticity,moisturizing,prevents dehydration,reduces wrinkles,retains moisture,skin protection
Uses: acne-prone skin,atopic dermatitis,colored hair,dehydrated skin,dry hair,dry skin,mature skin,premature aging,psoriasis,seborrheic dermatitis,split ends repair
Recommended dosage: 2 - 31%, up to 100% (Lotion Crafter); 5 TO 70% - 5 to 15% in creams and balms, 30 to 70% in "dry" oils (Aroma-zone)
Formulation tips: Vegetable Squalane is insoluble in water and will not be able to dissolve in an aqueous product, however, in a gel of sufficiently viscous consistency, it will be possible to introduce, at the end of the formulation, up to 5% of Squalane vegetal dispersion (possibly stirring the product before use if Squalane separates).

Description:
APPLICATIONS

stabilizing / thickening emulsions
firmer lotion bars
hardening soaps

Stearic Acid is triple pressed, Kosher and Food Grade, the fatty acids from vegetable source is an excellent thickener and emulsion stabilizer for lotions and creams where Stearic Acid also improves the silkiness and glide of emulsions. Stearic Acid also makes an effective additive to improve the stiffness in stick products, soy candles, and the like. Often Stearic Acid is used to harden soaps, when neutralized Stearic Acid forms an in-situ soap (Sodium Stearate) which can be used as an emulsifier or cleansing agent.

We use it to thicken and harden our products when we want thickening and hardening, but we don’t want waxiness. Because stearic acid is an isolated fatty acid it thickens without adding the tack or brittle stiffness that wax can contribute.

Stearic acid is a naturally saturated occurring fatty acid that’s found in many oils we love. You’ll find it in relatively high percentages in hard oils and butters like cocoa butter (24–37% stearic acid), shea butter (20–50% stearic acid), and tallow (14% stearic acid)—it’s a big part of what makes them hard oils!

Stearic acid melts at 69.3°C (156.7°F) (that’s a higher melting point than beeswax!), making it a very effective hardening ingredient that raises the melting points of our products without adding any waxiness. It can be sourced from animal or plant sources, or synthesized, so if the origins of your ingredients are important to you, be sure to ask your supplier. You’ll also find derivatives of stearic acid in many other ingredients, like magnesium stearate and stearyl alcohol, and find it on ingredient lists for many different products—everything from soap to lotion to cosmetics. It creates a hard bar of soap with stable, creamy lather, contributes to stable emulsions, thickens and hardens concoctions, and adds occlusiveness. It’s pretty darn useful! It’s also very shelf stable and inexpensive.
Formulation tips: Added to the oil phase.

INCI: Glycerine*, Prunus amygdalus dulcis (Sweet Almond) oil*, Sucrose Laurate, Citrus aurantium dulcis (Orange) fruit water*. *Organically produced ingredients. From 94% organic ingredients.
Description:
A clear, yellow liquid with a slight aroma. 100% vegetable origin combining non palm-derived organic glycerin sourced from the nut oil of the Karanja tree, sweet almond oil, water from organic oranges and sugar esters. All plant sources are non GMO and it is PEG free. Readily biodegradable.

It makes oil in water (O/W) emulsions as an emulsifier but also thickens oils to give a thick gel texture.

Although this emulsifier contains water, it does not need a preservative in this state as the ratio of water to glycerine keeps the product protected.
Composition:
Ingredients ratio of Sucragel AOF Bio:
Glycerin 50 - 60% 
Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil 25 - 35% 
Sucrose Laurate 5 - 8% 
Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Fruit Water 1 - 5%
Formulation tips:
When it is used with fats only, it still does not need a preservative.

As soon as you add water though, you need to include a preservative.

It is sensitive to pH extremes and is stable between pH4 to pH8.

Skin Care
A gelée made with Sucragel AOF Bio gives continual skin hydration for up to 8 hours after it has been applied.

Glycerine is an excellent humectant that helps to keep the skin hydrated. As Sucragel AOF Bio contains up to at least 50% glycerine, you don’t need to add any more glycerine to your formulations. By using 6% of the emulsifier, you will have 3% glycerine in your cream already.

Excellent to make rinse off cleansers and makeup removers.

Safe for sensitive skin and baby products.

Makes bath oils that emulsify into “bath blooms”.

Hair Care
It is not cationic so has very little use in hair care products.

Other
Use 6% to 99%.

Water soluble but will hold and thicken oils in an oil only blend.

Bath Bloom 99% Sucragel AOF Bio to 1% essential oils.

Bath Serum 15% Sucragel AOF Bio to 85% mixed oils and essential oils.

Gel Scrub 25% Sucragel AOF Bio to 70% mixed oils and essential oils plus 5% exfoliant.

If using solid fats or butters, melt first and combine with other heat tolerant oils before combining with the Sucragel AOF Bio. Heat safe up to 80°C. Use a double boiler and do not heat higher than this as it will damage the sugar in the emulsifier.

Do not combine with salts as an exfoliant as this will cause the emulsifier to separate.

Finished products made with Sucragel AOF Bio should be kept above pH 4.5 and below pH 8 or to ensure the emulsion remains stable.

To make an oily gelée, stir the Sucragel AOF Bio so that it starts to go slightly opaque.
Combine ALL of the fat/oil ingredients and mix together to be consistent. A typical ratio would be 25% Sucragel AOF Bio to 75% mixed oils.

Add a small amount to the Sucragel AOF Bio whilst stirring quickly. The mixed oils will be absorbed into the emulsifier like a sponge. An electric mixer with a spiral dough hook is excellent for this. We have found that a stick blender is too fast.

Continue to add small amounts of oil and stir in until all ingredients are absorbed. The gelée should thicken more after every oil addition.

The higher the ratio of the Sucragel AOF that is used, the thinner the resulting oily gelée will be.

To make a cream texture, water needs to be added. When the oily gelée is mixed with water, it emulsifies immediately into a very thin, runny milk. It loses all texture. Therefore, to get texture in a cream, you need to add thickened water (a gel) to the oily gelée. The resulting cream will be a little looser than the thickness of the water gel you added.

Suggested Blends
Excellent for using heat sensitive oils like Kiwi Seed and Rosehip Seed Oil  that cannot normally be emulsified by using heated methods.

Basic Oil Gelée
Stage 1: (room temperature)
75% Vegetable Oils of your choice

Stage 2: (room temperature)
25% Sucragel AOF Bio
100% Total

Method:
Combine all Stage 1 (fat stage) materials together.

Start stirring the Sucragel AOF Bio with a spatula until it goes slightly opaque.

Add a small amount of the Stage 1 oil blend and stir into the Sucragel AOF Bio until it is fully absorbed.

Keep adding more oil a little at a time. Do not add a large amount in one go. It must be fully incorporated after each addition by stirring.

When all ingredients are fully incorporated, jar and label.
Incompatibility:
Do not combine with salts as an exfoliant as this will cause the emulsifier to separate.

It is not cationic so has very little use in hair care products.

Description:
Sucrose Cocoate is a mild, natural nonionic surfactant produced from sugar and coconut oil. It belongs to the family of sucrose esters which are mild surfactants, co-surfactants and coemulsifiers.
Because of its excellent mildness, skin feel and refatting it could be applied in almost all leave-on and rinse-off products. It has foam stabilizing, skin conditioning and antistatic properties.
Composition: Produced from sugar and coconut oil.
Type of formulation: Shampoo,Cleansers,Cleansing milks,Shower gel,Conditioner,Makeup remover,Baby/children care,Skin care,Hair care
Formulation tips: Sucrose Cocoate is delivered as a high viscosity paste with ca. 65% active matter. It should be first dispersed in water at ca 65-70 degrees Celsius before imparting into a given formulation.

Description: Sucrose stearate is a very versatile natural emulsifier for a broad range of O/W emulsions. It could be applied in cold process, in warm process or in cold-warm process as a stand-alone emulsifier or blended (1-1.5%) with other emulsifiers to enhance stability and skin feel. It creates smooth and silky emulsions with no soapiness or greasiness.
Characteristics: No soaping effect,Non-greasy,Silky feel,"Smooth, satin-like feeling to the skin"
Formulation tips:
You can add Sucrose stearate into the water phase, into the oil phase or in a one pot process (blending oil and water phase from the very beginning). Adding sucrose stearate to the water phase creates emulsions with slightly higher viscosities compared to emulsions where sucrose stearate is added to the oil phase.
We recommend applying an emulsion stabilizer such as xanthan, sclerotium, acacia, konjak or LBG.
(Skin Chakra)

Properties/actions: anti-dandruff,calming; soothing,conditioning,prevents wrinkles,removes impurities and dead skin,retains moisture,emollient,reduces inflammation,reduces wrinkles,relieves dry skin,relieves itchy skin,revitalising,skin nourishing
Uses: burns,dry skin,hair - dandruff,hair loss,inflammation,itching,split ends repair,sunburn,mature skin,sensitive skin,wrinkles

INCI: Caprylyl/Capryl Glycosides; Aqua; Sodium Cocoyl Glutamate; Polyglyceryl-5 Oleate; Glyceryl Caprylate; Citric Acid
Description: Symbio Solv Clear can be employed in various cosmetic products. It yields transparent solutions of most perfume oils and essential oils in aqueous formulations, thus making it invaluable for tonics or oral care products. As a powerful solubilizer, it can also be used in surfactant based products like shampoos or shower gels, and as a co-emulsifier in O/W-emulsions. The product can be used in alcohol-containing and alcohol-free product concepts. Due to its hydrophilic structure, it has a good water-binding capacity and leaves a pleasant skin feel without feeling sticky. It is Ecocert, Cosmos and Natrue certified. It is PEG and PPG free.
Formulation tips: Symbio®solv clear is easy to handle and allows to work at room temperature and under low stirring. Usage Rate: 1:1 – 1:5 (oil: solubilizer)

INCI: Caprylyl/Capryl Glucoside; Aqua; Sodium Cocoyl Glutamate; Glyceryl Caprylate; Citric Acid; Polyglyceryl-6 Oleate; Sodium Surfactin
Description:
Symbio®Solv Clear Plus is a solubiliser blend perfect for use in transparent cosmetic products (both alcohol based and non-alcohol based).This solubiser is 100% naturally derived, and is wheat free and PEG free, offering a great alternative to other similar products on the market.

This is a new solubilizer from the Natural solubilizer family , approved and conform for "natural" formulations. It is a PEG-free and a gluten free solubilizer and is going to replace both Natural solubilizer XC and Natural solubilizer clear from May 2018.
Natural solubilizer clear plus is very similar to the previous Natural solubilizer varieties. It has a much lighter colour than Natural solubilizer XC and its color doesn't have any impact on the finished product. It has no inherent scent of its own. It foams slightly more than Natural solubilizer clear and Natural solubilizer XC but by adding some Pentylene glycol and to the formulation you can reduce the concentration of the solubilizer and reduce the amount of foam.

Symbiosolv clear plus has a low viscosity, similar to 85% glycerine and is quite easy to dose both in small and large scale.

Produces higher volumes of foam when compared to its predecessors.
Type of formulation: Toner,Oral care,Shampoo,Shower gel,Oil-in-water emulsions,Micellar water,Hair mist,Low surfactant cleansers
Recommended dosage: Max. 5%. Application dosage: dosage depends on the fragrance or essential oil and varies from ingredient to ingredient. It is usually between 1:3-1:5 (5 parts solubilizer for 1 part EO).
Formulation tips:
Working with a solubiliser is quite easy. Usually you blend your essential oil and the natural solubiliser together first in a beaker. If your preservative has any oil-soluble components (such as Benzyl alcohol) you should blend the preservative in this step together with the essential oil and the solubiliser.

Depending on the essential oil, the ratio between essential oil and solubiliser usually ranges between 1:4 – 1:8. This means you blend one part essential oil with between 4 and 8 parts solubiliser.

Then blend all your water-soluble ingredients together in a separate beaker, including your extracts and humectants. After both phases (water-soluble phase and the solubiliser phase) are homogeneous, slowly add the solubiliser phase to the water phase and blend the mixture. Measure and adjust the pH and voila! Here is your transparent/transluscent product.

I have experienced that for some essential oils, the blend needs time to become completely transparent. If your blend is not transparent immediately after preparation, wait up to 24 hours before you decide to increase the dosage of the natural solubiliser.

https://formulabotanica.com/how-to-use-a-natural-solubiliser/

----

How to use it?You assign % in the formula for the solubiliser and reduce the hydrosols accordingly. The percentage depends on the supplier’s recommendation, but, in general, it can be along the lines of:• EO : solubiliser ratio = 1:4 • EO : solubiliser ratio = 1:8Please always check the supplier’s guide for the ratio.Mix essential oils with the solubiliser before adding it to the base product.

----
Natural solubilizer Clear plus is applied like other solubilizers. It is applied to impart fragrance oils and essential oils into aqueous solutions (tonic, body splash, low surfactant cleansers, hair mist, micellar water etc.).
It can tolerate max. 10% of alcohol.

To find the right dosage: test different ratios with each different oil or combination of oils to be used in a product.
Step by step procedure:

Make 20-25 gr batches at this step.

Make a 1:4 blend of EO:solubilizer in a small beaker. (We're working with 1% EO concentration meaning 1% EO and 4% solubilizer).

Weight your water (100%-(EO+solubilizer)) in another beaker.Add the EO+solubilizer blend to water in small aliquots. Wait for complete dispersion before each subsequent addition. Blend the mixture for a few minutes.

If the blend looks transparent, reduce the concentration of the solubilizer and see whether it works. If the solution is not transparent, increase the concentration of the solubilizer until you reach a concentration that works.
After we've found the golden ratio, let's say a 1:4 ratio for the EO: solubilizer we need to move to the next step. The next step would be to store your sample for at least 24 hours in the fridge and see whether any turbidity or separation would follow. If this is the case you need to increase the solubilizer:EO ratio and repeat the test again.

If you're lucky enough and the sample is OK then you'll move to the next step which is adding other ingredients.

If your preservative is completely water soluble, make a small batch of your final formulation (30-50 gr), add the preservative, adjust the pH and then run the necessary stability tests before scaling up.



If your preservative has some oil soluble components and is not completely water soluble, you'll need to blend the EO and the preservative and find out the optimim/minimum ratio of the solubilizer for the EO+preservative. You may need to increase the concentration of the solubilizer to fully solubilizer the preservative. After finding the golden ratio, run your fridge test and move to the final formulation after your fridge test has been passed succesfully.

skinchakra
Incompatibility: Please note this product is incompatible with vegetable oils and cationic compounds.

Description:
Varisoft EQ 65 is a green, readily biodegradable cationic or positively charged ester quat derived from stearic acid and combined with cetearyl alcohol to act as a thickener and conditioning agent for emulsions and hair care products.

Hair care products and lotions made with Varisoft EQ 65 are rich and creamy with the distinctive dry, powdery skin feel of cationic emulsifiers. They are substantive and conditioning to skin and hair, while improving wet detangling and combing, and offering superior dry combing and hair feel.

Varisoft EQ 65 can be used as the primary positively charged ingredient for hair care products such as leave in conditioners, rinse off conditioners, hair masks, and intense treatments, as well as an emulsifier for lotions, creams, and body butters in which you want a green, biodegradable product with a less greasy and smooth skin feel with low tackiness. 
Hair care products made with 2% Varisoft EQ 65 offer excellent rinse-ability, increased ease of styling, and increased gloss when compared to 2% Behentrimonium Chloride, and increased hair volume, bounce, dry and wet feel along with dry and wet combing compared to 2% Cetrimonium Chloride. Compared to alkyl quats like Behentrimonium Methosulfate or Stearamidopropyl Dimethylamine, conditioners made with Varisoft EQ 65 weigh hair down less. 


Key Benefits

ECOcert and COSMOS certified Green and readily biodegradable
Increased rinseability, ease of styling, and increased gloss when compared to alkyl quats like Behentrimonium Chloride in hair care products 
Increased volume, bounce, and improved wet and dry feel as well as wet and dry combing compared to Cetrimonium Chloride in hair care products
Reduced weighing down of hair 
Produces a smooth, less greasy, powdery skin feel in emulsions
Increased substantivity and conditioning for skin in body care products

Applications

Eco and green hair care products, including conditioners, leave in conditioners, and conditioning masks.
Eco and green body care products, including lotions, moisturizers, and creams as the emulsifier
Sun care and after sun care products due to the smooth skin feel and low tackiness
Composition:
cationic or positively charged ester quat derived from stearic acid and combined with cetearyl alcohol
Varisoft EQ 65 contains cetearyl alcohol as a thickener (65% active distearoylethyl dimonium chloride to 35% cetearyl alcohol)
Characteristics: Powdery skin feel,Dry skin feel,Less greasy skin feel,Smooth feel to the hair,"Smooth, satin-like feeling to the skin",Low tackiness
Properties/actions: hair detangler,improved wet hair comb,improves feel and styleability of hair,hair volume,hair bounce,reduced weighing down of hair
Type of formulation: Leave-on conditioners,Conditioner bars,Conditioner,Hair mask,Lotions,Creams,Body cream,Body lotion,Body butter,After sun products,Sun care,Rinse-off conditioners
Stable within a pH range of: Aim for a pH of 4.0 – 5.0, preferably below 4.5.
Formulation tips:
To be dispersed in water at +/- 80-85 degrees C. 
___
Varisoft EQ 65 contains cetearyl alcohol as a thickener (65% active distearoylethyl dimonium chloride to 35% cetearyl alcohol), but additional fatty alcohols such as Cetyl or Behenyl Alcohol can be added to increase substantivity and conditioning as well as viscosity. Generally, add 0.5% fatty alcohol for every 1% Varisoft EQ 65 used. 
___
In emulsions and conditioners with a small oil phase, Varisoft EQ 65 can be measured into the water phase and heated to 75°- 85°C (167°-176°F) along with any other heat tolerant oil or water soluble ingredients or dispersed into the water at 80°- 85°C (176°-185°F).
___
Adding non-ionic emulsifiers such as Ceteareth-20 or Olivem 800 (INCI: Ceteareth-6 Olivate) at 1% to 3% will improve the processing of the pellets in water.
___
Preservatives can be added at 40°C (104°F) with mixing, then allow the product to cool to room temperature.
___
Optimal viscosity can be reached by mixing the product at 30°C (86°F) or under for 30 seconds to 1 minute.  
___
In emulsions and conditioners with a larger oil phase, Varisoft EQ 65 and other oil or silicone soluble ingredients may be heated at up to 85°C (185°F) while heating the water phase to a similar temperature, before combining and mixing with high shear in a separate container, then combined with the water phase and mixed with high shear. Allow to cool to 40°C (104°F) before adding preservative, fragrance or essential oils, or other cool down ingredients. Allow the product to cool to room temperature before mixing again for 30 seconds to 1 minute to obtain optimal viscosity. 
___
In any product, the pH should be adjusted at the end of the formulating process to pH 4 to 4.5 as it can hydrolyze at pH levels higher than 5. This can be done by adding drops of a solution of 50% Citric Acid Solution and testing until it reaches ideal pH.
(Lotion Crafter)

INCI: Wheat Amino Acids, Soy Amino Acids, Arginine HCl, Serine, Threonine
Description:
VegeKeratinTM is a vegetable alternative to animal keratin. It increases hair strength, enhances elasticity, helps protect hair from harsh salon processes, makes hair look more healthy and shiny, and improves the comb-ability of hair.

Keratin is a protein composed of 18 amino acids. It is one of the primary structural components of hair, nails, and the epidermis. Keratin keeps hair healthy and lessens damage. VegeKeratinTM is an alternative to animal-based keratin. It contains wheat and soy amino acids, carefully blended to mimic the functional ratios in human hair amino acids.

VegeKeratinTM is 10.51% Arginine, which is the most nitrogen-rich amino acid, and which helps reinforce and strengthen hair fibers. 

Benefits:

Increases hair strength
Enhances elasticity
Protects hair from harsh salon processes
Makes hair look more shiny & healthy
Improves combability of hair (wet and dry combing)
Reduces static and frizz, making hair easier to style
Vegan, non-GMO, natural, and sustainable
Paraben-free and formaldehyde-free
Less odor than animal-derived keratin
Applications:

Shampoos, conditioners
Leave-on hair treatments
Hair styling products
In vitro tests:

In laboratory tests,VegeKeratinTM showed better than 18% improvement in elasticity for damaged (triple bleached) Caucasian hair. VegeKeratinTM was shown to provide similar strength increases as hydrolyzed animal keratin. In damaged African hair, VegeKeratinTM showed a 16% increase in elasticity and a 3.9% increase in strength compared to control.

Laboratory tests also showed that VegeKeratinTM delivers similar levels of antioxidant protection as hydrolyzed animal keratin.

(Lotion Crafter)
Properties/actions: antistatic,hair protection,hair shine,improves hair strength,"increases hair elasticity, manageability and shine",protection against environmental stressors that can cause damage to hair,Protects hair from harsh salon processes
Uses: thin hair
Formulation tips:
Needs to be added in the aqueous phase of formulations.
In the case of  hot-process emulsions, it should be added once the emulsion is formed and at temperatures below 104°F (40°C).
Soluble in water.
pH of final formulation should be 4.0 - 7.5

INCI: Water /Aqua (&) Propanediol (plant based) (&) Tremella Fuciformis (Mushroom) Extract (&) Gluconolactone (&) Calcium gluconate
Description:
VEGELURON ® GEL, Ecocert approved
VEGELURON ® is often considered as a plant based hyaluronic acid. It is a clear colorless gel with a superior moisturizing and a light film forming effect with a soft touch. It has an extraordinary transparency. The original viscosity is around 16000-20000 mPaS and you can dilute it up to 50% without a significant change in the viscosity.
It is based on a polysaccharide composed of mannose units substituted with xylose and glucuronic acid units. This polymer is extracted from the mushroom Tremella fuciformis, an edible white gelly mushroom (known as snow mushroom).
VEGELURON ® GEL has a superior water retention capacity and is able to efficiently moisturize skin and hair. It is a plant based alternative to hyaluronic acid. Its softness makes it also a natural alternative to silicones.
You can apply VEGELURON ® as it is in an airless or a lotion bottle as a moisturizing serum or apply it into your creams and lotions as well as hair and facial tonics. Blend it simply with a hydrosol of your choice (rosewater for example), you can blend it in a 1:1 ratio with the hydrosol and still have the gel consistency and viscosity. VEGELURON ® is preserved and doesn't need any preservation in the pure form.
Recommended dosage:
1-10% in creams, lotions and tonics, 
50-60% in concentrated serums
Formulation tips:
You can dilute it up to 50% without a significant change in the viscosity.
Blend it simply with a hydrosol of your choice (rosewater for example), you can blend it in a 1:1 ratio with the hydrosol and still have the gel consistency and viscosity. VEGELURON ® is preserved and doesn't need any preservation in the pure form.

Preservative type: Not broad spectrum for emulsions,Broad spectrum for water based products

Uses: acne-prone skin,allergic dermatitis,atopic dermatitis,bruises,cuts,dehydrated skin,dry skin,dull skin,eczema,irritated skin,mature skin,muscle pains,oily skin,skin toner,stretch marks,tired-looking skin,wounds; scratches,wrinkles

Description:
This is an ingredient which works really great on skin; as I already mentioned above, it has anti-inflammatory properties, soothing properties (if used up to 2%) and it helps fighting blemishes (at concentration up to 4%), it normalizes sebum production and it also helps against any discoloration of the skin. 

Niacinamide powder is the active form of Vitamin B3. A safe, nonirritating cosmeceutical ingredient which research shows can offer a number of benefits in improving the appearance of aged and photodamaged skin and improve skin moisturization.
While its precise mechanism of action is not clear, clinical studies have shown topical niacinamide to be effective in improving skin texture and the appearance of hyperpigmented spots, with improvement in red blotchiness and the reduction of the severity of fine lines.
It has been shown to stimulate collagen synthesis and production of ceramide, a lipid compound that contributes to the functional and structural integrity of the skin barrier. Theoretically, by improving barrier integrity, niacinamide may help the skin become more resistant to external irritants.  
(Lotion Crafter)
Properties/actions: helps stimulate collagen synthesis,improves barrier properties of the skin,improves skin texture ,moisturizing,reduces hypepigmentation,reduces redness,reduces wrinkles,stimulates ceramide synthesis in the skin
Uses: hyperpigmentation,improves skin tone,mature skin,photodamaged skin,redness; rosacea; blemishes
Formulation tips:
Add to the heated water phase of formulations
Can be added directly into a finished cream or base cream
Avoid use in acidic formulations to avoid hydrolysis and formation of nicotinic acid (which can be irritating to skin)
Final pH of product should be about pH 6
Hazards / Safety data:
This Nicotinamide is a close close friend of Nicotinic Acid; it is, in fact, the amide of nicotinic acid and this acid causes flushing and burning sensation of the skin (definitely the opposite of the soothing property we are looking for…). If you happen to apply nicotinic acid to your face, you might really ruin your skin… so let me tell you what happens when we try to make our serum with Nicotinamide and why it is VERY IMPORTANT that you own pH TEST STRIPS!
Nicotinamide is stable at a pH range between 5.5 and 7. If your serum has this pH, you are having Niacinamide in it.
However, if the pH is too acid (or even too basic), the Niacinamide goes through a reaction and the Nicotinic Acid is formed.
(https://itsallinmyhands.com/2014/03/10/hyaluronic-acid-serum-for-problem-skin/)
Shelf life: 3 years from the date of manufacture, if stored in a cool, dry place in a sealed container.
Conservation tips: Avoid temperatures over 104°F (40°C) as this may affect the efficacy of the product. Optimum storage temperature is 75°F (24°C) or lower. Do not freeze. Avoid exposure to sunlight for long periods.

Description: This natural antioxidant helps preserve vegetable oils and butters from rancidity. The addition of vitamin E is therefore recommended in all preparations containing sensitive oils and in the formulas of oily balms and mixtures, which it will extend the shelf life. Vitamin E also has a very interesting role on the skin: it is an excellent anti-aging active ingredient, particularly recommended for dry and mature skin and in after-sun repair treatments.
Uses: after-sun,dry skin,mature skin,premature aging
Recommended dosage: 0.02 TO 0.5% (As antioxidant: 0.02 to 0.2% (of the weight of oils to keep) As active: 0.1 to 0.5% (of the total weight of the preparation)
Formulation tips:
Add in vitamin E in the cold finished formula and mix well to homogenize. 
Compatible with all emulsifiers and gums.

Trade name: White Water Lily Flower extract - glycerite
INCI: Nymphaea Alba (White Water Lily) Flower Extract
Appearance: Liquide de couleur jaune à ambrée, à l'odeur douce et végétale
Description:
Actif cosmétique hydratant, purifiant et astringent

Evoquant pureté, fraîcheur et zénitude, le Nénuphar blanc est une plante aquatique qui pousse dans les eaux calmes principalement en Europe et en Asie. Ses fleurs majestueuses et charnues d'un blanc éclatant sont riches en nutriments et en principes actifs hydratants, purifiants et antioxydants. Les fleurs de Nénuphar sont ainsi réputées comme actif cosmétique pour leur action purifiante, embellisante et hydratante ce qui fait de cet extrait un ingrédient de choix dans les soins des peaux sèches.

SOIN DE LA PEAU
PROPRIÉTÉS
Hydratant des couches supérieures de l'épiderme
Purifiant et astringent
Reminéralisant
Anti-âge préventif
INDICATIONS
S'utilise en tant qu'ingrédient dans vos préparations :

Peaux jeunes
Peaux mixtes et grasses
Peaux ternes et déshydratées
Soins préventifs anti-âge
QUELQUES IDÉES
S'utilise en tant qu'ingrédient dans vos préparations :

Crèmes hydratantes "zen"
Gels-crèmes fraîcheur astringents
Crèmes corporelles revitalisantes
Fluides hydratants peaux mixtes
Crèmes de nuit ressourçantes et reminéralisantes

Le Nénuphar blanc est une plante herbacée, vivace de la famille des Nymphaeacées.  Cette plante aquatique pousse dans les eaux calmes où le courant est quasi inexistant comme les eaux dormantes, les marais, les bras morts de rivières ou le plus souvent dans les lacs. Elle peut atteindre 2 mètres de hauteur à l’âge adulte et la plupart de ses organes sont immergés. Elle ne laisse apparaitre à la surface que ses grandes feuilles circulaires étalées sur l’eau et ses fleurs solitaires terminales d’une blancheur éclatante. Ces dernières s’ouvrent le matin et se referment le soir pour la nuit.Aussi appelées reine des lacs, lune d’eau ou encore lis des étangs, la fleur de nénuphar blanc ne contient pas de nectar et peut atteindre 12 centimètres de large. Les fleurs contiennent beaucoup de mucilage aux propriétés adoucissantes et hydratantes. Cet extrait contient également des antioxydants, les flavonoïdes et les tanins, et des minéraux purifiants.
Ainsi, cet extrait sera parfait pour confectionner des soins "maison" grâce à ses propriétés purifiantes, astringentes et hydratantes.
Composition:
Aqua, Glycerin, Nymphaea alba flower extract, sodium benzoate, potassium sorbate (ces 2 derniers sont des conservateurs synthétiques acceptés par Ecocert dans les cosmétiques BIO), citric acid (ajusteur de pH naturel)

Macération à basse température de fleurs de Nénuphar blanc dans un mélange d'eau et de glycérine végétale.

Les actifs contenus dans les fleurs de Nénuphar sont pour leur majorité solubles dans un milieu aqueux. Ainsi en les faisant macérer dans un mélange eau / glycérine, les actifs vont très facilement se solubiliser dans le liquide d’extraction. Après filtration, on obtient un mélange eau / glycérine chargé avec les actifs de la plante.

- Vitamines, dont vitamine C : antioxydante et stimulante de la synthèse du collagène, elle a une action anti-âge.
- Protéines : elles nourrissent et renforcent l'hydratation de la peau.
- Minéraux : ils participent à de nombreux mécanismes physiologiques et ont une action purifiante et reminéralisante.
- Mucilages : ces polysaccharides végétaux ont des propriétés adoucissantes et hydratantes.
- Flavonoïdes : ils ont des propriétés antioxydantes et préviennent la dégradation de l'élastine et de l'acide hyaluronique naturellement présents dans la peau.
- Tanins : ces composés phénoliques ont un effet astringent et sont également des antioxydants.
Uses: dull skin,mixed skin,oily skin,skin hydration,young skin
Recommended dosage: 1 - 10% (1 - 5% dans les crèmes et laits ; 1- 10% dans les lotions, gels, produits moussants...)
Formulation tips:
L'extrait de fleurs de Nénuphar peut être intégré dans toutes vos formules contenant de l'eau : crèmes, laits, gels, lotions, gels douche...
	
INTÉGRER L'EXTRAIT DANS TOUTES VOS FORMULES CONTENANT DE L'EAU
	 Incorporez l'extrait de fleurs de Nénuphar à froid, en fin de formulation.		 Agitez longuement pour bien homogénéiser.

L'extrait de fleurs de nénuphar se marie avec tous les extraits de fleurs précieuses, en particulier la Rose et le Lotus.
Pour une ambiance zen et aquatique, associez-le aux extraits de Bambou, Lotus et Melon d'eau.

Cette huile au toucher sec et aux propriétés équilibrantes convient parfaitement à vos soins pour peaux mixtes à grasses. C'est également un ingrédient idéal pour nourrir et discipliner les cheveux bouclés et afros.

SOIN DE LA PEAU
PROPRIÉTÉS
Régulatrice et matifiante
Très bonne pénétration, elle pénètre vite dans la peau et ne laisse pas de film gras.
Nourrissante et équilibrante
INDICATIONS
Peaux mixtes et grasses
Peaux à imperfections (acné...)
UTILISATIONS
En tant qu'ingrédient dans vos préparations:

Crèmes fluides pour les peaux mixtes
Crèmes et lotions matifiantes et régulatrices
Savons
Huiles de massage
QUELQUES IDÉES

HE = Huile Essentielle - HV = Huile Végétale C. à C. = Cuillère à café - C. à S. = Cuillère à soupe

SYNERGIES
Pour un effet matifiant renforcé : Poudre de Arrow root, Sève de Bambou et poudre de Riz micronisée.
EN PRATIQUE
L'huile végétale de Yangu s'utilise en tant qu"ingrédient dans vos préparations cosmétiques.

SOIN DES CHEVEUX
PROPRIÉTÉS
Nourrit et protège les cheveux.
Protection des couleurs capillaires soumises aux expositions solaires
Discipline les cheveux bouclés.
INDICATIONS
Soins des cheveux abîmés et colorés
Cheveux frisés et crépus,  cheveux afros
Cheveux secs, abîmés, dévitalisés
Cheveux indisciplinés
UTILISATIONS
S'utilise en tant qu'ingrédient dans vos préparations de soins pour les cheveux :

Créer des soins pour cheveux afros
Shampooings et masques capillaires
Baumes nourrissants
Huiles capillaires protection de couleurs
QUELQUES IDÉES

HE = Huile Essentielle - HV = Huile Végétale - C. à C. = Cuillère à café - C. à S. = Cuillère à soupe

SYNERGIES
Pour la protection des couleurs : huiles végétales de Coco, Sapote, Kukui, beurres végétaux de Mangue, Karité, Sal, Kokum et Murumuru, Céramides végétales.
EN PRATIQUE
L'huile végétale de Yangu s'utilise en tant qu"ingrédient dans vos préparations cosmétiques. 

L'huile végétale de Yangu provient des fruits du Calendodrum capense, arbre africain largement répandu sur la partie sud de ce continent où il peut atteindre plus de 20 mètres de haut à l'état sauvage. L'huile de Yangu, très populaire en Afrique, est traditionnellement utilisée par la tribu Kikuyu, vivant au pied du Mont Kenya, pour les soins de la peau et des cheveux.

Sa composition unique, non grasse, lui procure des propriétés matifiantes et régulatrices, convenant parfaitement aux peaux mixtes et grasses à imperfections.
C'est également un ingérdient idéal dans les soins capillaires pour discipliner les cheveux bouclés et afros.

Description:
Yucca stem extract is actually the juice of the stem (no solvents or carriers are applied). This juice is cold pressed and concentrated to ca. 50% water content, is filtered and pasteurized and then preserved by addition of 0.1% Sodium benzoate.
Yucca extract is completely water soluble and has a pH of about 3.8 and a saponin content of ca. 9.3%.
Since yucca saponins are belonged to non-ionic surfactants, it is compatible with all other surfactant groups (anionic, cationic, amphoteric). 
Yucca extract is applied in food and dietary supplement industry and in skin care industry. It is applicable as a solo-surfactant or a co-surfactant and as a co-emulsifier and emulsion stabilizer. It has an intensive caramel like colour. We recommend its application together with other natural surfactants in cleansing foams, gels and lotions, in shampoos and shower gels and in make-up removers. Application dosage is from 1-100% of surfactant concentration but we do not recommend its application more than 15% of the total formulation (mainly because of its price)
Recommended dosage: 1-100% (Skin Chakra recommends no more than 15%, mainly because of its cost)
Formulation tips:
Micellar water:
- 1% solo-surfactant
- 0.5% co-surfactant with 4% Cocamidopropyl betaine

Description:
Anhydrous Lanolin USP is produced from the multi-stage refining of wool grease, a natural, renewable raw material which is obtained from the scouring (washing) of raw wool. It is manufactured to fully meet the requirements of the current USP monograph. The product can be used in the most exacting applications where colour, odour and purity are critical. It is an excellent emollient and is readily absorbed by the skin. In addition, it has powerful w/o emulsifying properties. Anhydrous Lanolin USP can be used in all types of cosmetics, toiletries and pharmaceuticals where the reduced pesticides make it particularly suitable in applications for use in topical preparations such as baby creams.
(www.ulprospector.com)
Derived from sheep’s wool, lanolin is a type of natural wax composed of esters and hydroxy esters of lanolin acids and lanolin alcohols (lanolin alcohols are part of the unsaponifiables in lanolin). It also contains sterol esters and squalane, a bio-identical ingredient found in our skin’s sebum and stratum corneum. Unlike vegetable, nut, or seed oils, it contains no triglycerides. Instead, it contains cholesterol, a very effective emollient found in our skin. 

In all products, lanolin in a very effective moisturizer, and can be incorporated into a product hot or cold. It’s used as a barrier protectant and occlusive ingredient in lotions, creams, and anhydrous products to reduce transepidermal water loss by acting as an emollient to offer moisturizing and repel water. Lanolin may penetrate the upper layers of the stratum corneum and provide more long lasting moisturizing when compared to other natural oils. 

In anhydrous products, lanolin can hold up to 50% water by weight, so it can form simple water-in-oil creams. It’s used in manicure products to adhere to the nails and cuticles to soften and moisturize. 

In hair care products, lanolin can be used in small quantities in conditioners, including hair masks, conditioners, and leave in conditioners as an emollient. It can be used as a styling agent in anhydrous or water based pomades. 

Lanolin is used regularly in lipsticks as a more viscous emollient and in mascara as a plasticizer. It can be used in powdered cosmetics as a binder or pressing agent, or as a moisturizing and bonding ingredient in lip glosses. 

Lanolin is especially recommended for naturally dry skin or skin made drier by the elements, increasing the stratum corneum’s suppleness and hydration, and speeding up skin’s barrier protection mechanisms when used at as little as 3% in an emulsion.

Key Benefits

Very emollient, excellent for dry skin as an occlusive and moisturizer
Occlusive, preventing transepidermal water loss and speeding up skin’s barrier repair mechanisms
Can hold up to 50% of its weight in water, so small amounts of water can be incorporated into anhydrous products
Decreases transepidermal water loss
Softens and moisturizes skin and hair
Repels water well, creating a barrier for the skin
Plasticizes anhydrous bars and balms
Applications
Anhydrous products, such as balms, salves, lotion bars, and pomades
Emulsions as a barrier protectant ingredient and emollient
Color cosmetics, such as lipsticks and mascara as a plasticizer and emollient
Powdered color cosmetics as a binder or pressing agent
Lip balms and lotion bars as a plasticizer and emollient
Manicure products, such as cuticle and nail balms
Any products intended for dry to very dry or weather chapped skin
(Lotion Crafter)
